channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: How courts handled feathers, tea and knives
item.description: Claims under state and federal Religious Freedom Restoration Acts are rare, and most victories have involved religious minorities, experts say. Here are some cases. FULL STORY

item.title: Things you haven't considered about Indiana's religious freedom law
item.description: By now, you probably have a position regarding the controversy over Indiana's "religious freedom" law.

item.title: LZ: The real lesson of Indiana's anti-LGBT law
item.description: LZ Granderson: In replay of culture wars GOP hopefuls use LGBT issues to gain street cred with conservatives they need to woo for 2016.

item.title: Californians get mandatory water restrictions
item.description: "We're in a new era," Gov. Jerry Brown said. "The idea of your nice little green grass getting lots of water every day, that's going to be a thing of the past." FULL STORY

item.title: NCAA: We're not responsible for education
item.description: After years of making the case that the education of athletes is paramount, the NCAA now says it has no legal responsibility to make sure education is actually delivered.

item.title: Indicted senator 'angry, ready to fight'
item.description: A defiant Sen. Robert Menendez asserted his innocence and pledged to fight federal corruption charges, which he said were politically motivated and "intended to silence me." FULL STORY

item.title: Educators guilty of cheating
item.description: All but one of 12 defendants charged with racketeering and other crimes in the Atlanta Public Schools cheating scandal were convicted Wednesday.

item.title: Germanwings crash witness: I'll never fly again
item.description: CNN's Karl Penhaul speaks to an Alpine shepherd who witnessed Germanwings Flight 9525 crash and says he'll never fly again.

item.title: Gov.: Fix religious freedom bill
item.description: Arkansas Gov. Asa Hutchinson says he does not plan to sign the version of the "religious freedom" bill that lawmakers sent him and calls on the state Legislature to make changes. FULL STORY

item.title: 4 killed in oil rig fire
item.description: Four workers died in an oil rig fire that was still raging off the coast of Mexico hours after it started Wednesday.

item.title: Tsarnaevs, police no strangers
item.description: Some of the women in Dzhokhar Tsarnaev's family have had their own brushes with the law.

item.title: Yoga guru: I don't need to rape
item.description: In a CNN exclusive, Bikram yoga creator Bikram Choudhury reacts for the first time to allegations of rape or sexual assault by six of his former students.

item.title: Research changes date Anne Frank died
First wife of John Lennon dies
item.description: Cynthia Lennon, who married John Lennon when he was a struggling musician and was there when he rose to fame with the Beatles, died Wednesday, according to a post on the website of her son Julian.

item.title: Inside Mike Tyson's abandoned mansion
Opinion: Humans don't deserve executions
item.description: On May 28, 2014, some 7,000 people gathered in a stadium in China's northwestern Xinjiang region. But they had not come to watch the local football team or any other grand sporting event. Instead, the authorities paraded scores of prisoners dressed in orange jumpsuits. Armed soldiers guarded the exits. In the patently unfair, open air trial that followed, 55 people were found guilty of a range of offenses linked to violent attacks in the region and jailed. Three were sentenced to death.

item.title: Mass grave unearthed under university
item.description: Archaeologists have discovered a medieval graveyard estimating 1,300 burials located underneath Cambridge University.

item.title: Police: Getty grandson died of natural causes
item.description: Andrew Getty, one of the heirs to billions of oil money, appears to have died of natural causes, a Los Angeles Police Department spokesman said.

item.title: April Fools' Day: The best and worst pranks
The house that breaks up when you do
item.description: If there's such a thing as the perfect house for a divorce, this is it. After a split, the units can be broken in two and separated from one another.

item.title: NYPD cop in Uber video faces suspension
item.description: A New York police detective assigned to the FBI's Joint Terrorism Task Force with top-secret security clearance has been placed on modified assignment, and faces suspension, reassignment or loss of his clearance after an incident with an Uber driver Monday that was captured on video, officials said.

item.title: Deepak Chopra: The problem with atheism
item.description: No doubt faith is in crisis. But this applies, as is painfully shown in the CNN documentary on American atheism that broadcast last week, to the personal agony of families.

item.title: Noose found in tree on Duke campus
item.description: A noose was found hanging in a tree on the campus of Duke University. CNN's Brooke Baldwin speaks with WRAL reporter Amanda Lamb.

item.title: World's oldest person dies
item.description: Misao Okawa, the world's oldest person according to Guinness World Records, has died at the age of 117.

item.title: A real 'Fault in Our Stars' couple
Singer-songwriter Joni Mitchell hospitalized
item.description: Singer-songwriter Joni Mitchell has been hospitalized in Southern California.

item.title: Adam West, Burt Ward to reprise Batman roles
item.description: The skies over Gotham City might become bright once again in 2016, with Adam West and Burt Ward promising a return to their career-high roles of Batman and Robin as part of an upcoming animated project next year.

item.title: Scientology documentary: Fact or fiction?
item.description: In HBO's documentary film "Going Clear: Scientology and the Prison of Belief," former Scientology members talk about the inner workings of the church. But the church calls "Going Clear" propaganda. CNN's Stephanie Elam takes a look.

item.title: Best selfies of the week
People with Down syndrome sit for portraits
item.description: Icelandic photographer Sigga Ella wanted to show that people with Down syndrome are more than a chromosomal abnormality. They are diverse and they're unique, just like everyone else in the world.

item.title: Holding on to tradition
2015 Sony World Photography Awards
A glimpse of life on the reservation
item.description: Growing up in Germany, everything Felix von der Osten learned about Native Americans came from the books of 19th-century German writer Karl May.

item.title: Uplifting cards handed out to strangers in Detroit
item.description: Cards with messages like "Never give up" are being handed out to strangers in Detroit, but no one knows the group of girls doing it.

item.title: Living to 100 is easier here
item.description: Ikaria is known as the island where people forget to die. Bill Weir catches up with some of the extraordinary people living on the Greek island.

item.title: Hot shots: U.S. military's best photos
Selena: 20 years after her death
New 'Daily Show' host criticized for tweets
item.description: Trevor Noah is already facing heavy criticism from the Internet community less than 24 hours after being named Jon Stewart's replacement as host of "The Daily Show."

item.title: She passes out. In running car. In middle of freeway.
item.description: A California woman passes out while behind the wheel as her vehicle is on a freeway. KGTV's Steve Fiorina reports.

item.title: World's tallest hotel planned for tiny village
World's most visited palaces, castles
McCartney's ex targets ski speed record
item.description: Imagine traveling down a ski slope at 200km/h. Now imagine doing so on one leg.

item.title: Misstep almost sends Obama tumbling
item.description: President Obama managed to avoid embarrassment and a bruise or two when he recovered quickly after stumbling while deplaning from Air Force One.

item.title: Opinion: 'Daily Show' missed an opportunity
item.description: As a person-of-color, African-American, veteran minority journalist and longtime enthusiast of all things "Daily Show," I am of course as happy, proud and thrilled as the wife of a successful Apollo astronaut over the impending ascension of Trevor Noah, the biracial comedian from South Africa, to Jon Stewart's anchor chair on what's believed by many to be the most trusted half-hour of news and information in America.

item.title: What's 'true' about the cross that killed Jesus?
